description: Alteration and construction of front wall and railing
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing title number(s): 2013/2/01 (Existing Front Elecation - Front Elevation / Location and Site Plan), 2013/2/01 (Proposed Front Elevation - Front Elevation / Location and Site Plan), 2013/2/06 (Survey Drawing - Front Boundary Wall), 2013/2/07 (Proposed Drawing - Front Boundary Wall), 2013/2/08 (Proposed Drawing - Joinery / Gate Details), Design and Access Statement (Including Heritage Assessment) and Bedford Park Society - Technical note no 2.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those identified on the hereby approved drawings listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
